title: Basic monitoring, does its job
text:
This is a no-thrills app. Hasn’t been updated to fit to newer iPhones and displays with black bars on top and bottom. App will keep you logged in for a while and arbitrarily log you out. Interface is sluggish, and feels like it is a web interface encased in an iOS app.

But it does what it needs to do. Just wish it had a more up-to-date appearance, and some of the bugs ironed out. Based on other reviews it seems like this app is no longer maintained.

title: So far so good
text: Lots of negative reviews regarding responsiveness of the app...so far so good for me (just installed today 8/17). I would take those with a grain of salt as the apps responsiveness is heavily dependent on the connection speed and quality of the homes wifi network. For reference, I have a Netgear Orbi mesh system, am seeing plenty strong WiFi speed/strength at my main panel. Install was relatively easy, though I ended up having to invert my phases after install, which took a bit of support searching to find the advanced settings to do so. I also have solar monitoring and can confirm that the real time feedback of Neurio mirrors the generation figures I am seeing on my separate monitoring app supplied by my solar installer. On the consumption side, the reporting is near instant when a device cycles on (example A/C, pool pump, microwave, coffee machine). Loving the data so far and can’t wait to see what kind of stats I can play with once it does some learning. For all of those complaining about the iphoneX scaling—BFD...the app UI works just fine, regardless of not scaling full screen. People are petty. For what it’s worth, I was originally going to install a Sense CT monitoring system, but their CT clamps were too large for my bottom fed bus bar style main panel. Neurio’s “universal CT” clamps were the PERFECT low profile fit for my setup, so that alone made this system worth it!

title: Great when it works
text:
My solar installer installed this device with my solar system as he owed me a whole home monitoring system.  I’m starting to think this must have been the cheapest one available.  It won’t stop crashing or locking up forcing me to crash. Sometimes it’s so bad I have to reboot my iPhone just to get the app to open.  I’ve only had the app 5 days.  
When it does work, I like it. I have 2 Sunny Boy inverters by SMA and this app is more responsive and timely with the data then the SMA app.  It would be nice if it would auto refresh. Every time you view it, you have to switch screens and switch back to get the history chart to update. It would also be nice to be allowed to zoom out on the run chart.  Other whole home monitor systems also allow you to label the devices that turn on and off.  You can instantly see the spike when turning a device on or off, but there isn’t anyway to label it and then see a list of what’s on.   
All in all, a decent entry level monitoring system, but they must first get the app to be stable; this is very frustrating as it is today.

title: Generac does not seem to care about quality

They give it lip service and say they will fix, but they don’t even try as can be seen by frequency of releases. It’s probably safe to assume that if they don’t care about the quality of the app they probably also don’t care about the quality of their generators, so I will find another brand that cares. Very disappointed. Seriously it’s amazing that a major brand simply does not care about the propensity of one star reviews. Unbelievable.

title: App is Lame at best
text:
Neurio does it’s job and it is consistent as a hardware device. I’d even go so far as to say I like the hardware a lot. 

The software has always been abysmal though. And generac buying neurio has not changed that. Since then, the only thing that’s changed has been the app name and icon, twice. 

It’s slow to load/open w data.
Still no support for recent iPhone resolutions (looks like some kind of clown app).
The detection algorithms need to be completely retaught and re thought. They are useless and that section of the app barely works anyway. 
You can’t export the entire history of data at once in app or online.
No integrations with other platforms ie SmartThings.

Generally speaking you literally can just watch watts and watt-hours and if that’s enough for you then OK. But don’t expect anything smart. This is basic required functionality for a meter.

title: The best power monitoring program available
text:
First, this app only works with the Neurio power sensor module. This goes in your power panel and sends power usage data to Neurio's servers using WiFi. It's not cheap, but it's worked reliably for me for over a year. 

I've owned several power monitoring systems, but the Neurio is the best I've had. It has separate input for mains power and solar power so you can track your generation and compare to the grid. 

It has a feature that attempts to identify which appliances are active and maintains a running total. This gives you insight into how much power a specific appliance uses. It tracks things like AC, microwave ovens, refrigerators, heaters, and virtually any other device that pull significant power. It will generally not be able to detect small appliances or devices that use less than 400 watts. 

The feature I use most often is the 'Always On'. This attempts to identify your lowest power usage that is always on. When I first started using this app, I had over a 1000 watts that was always on. This was items like wall AC adapters, lights, and various electronic devices. By converting to LED bulbs, adding some timers, or just unplugging unused devices, I was able to get my always on to under 500 watts.  That's still a bit high, but 500 watts saved that was on for 24 hours a day really adds up!

This app does has a few flaws, but the Neurio team is issuing updates on a regular basis.

title: Great app and product
text: The good:  excellent app, great energy monitor, and reasonable price. For keeping an eye on minute to minute or day to day energy use at the household level this product can't be beat. The app is super clever with all sorts of useful ways to look at the data -- far better than competing platforms I looked at. Not as good: the appliance recognition...if you want granular and reliable data about how much energy your a/c or heat pump or oven is using, this isn't the product.. Sometimes it works, often it doesn't. Despite that, I'm very happy with the app and product.

title: Excellent product
text: Paired with the Neurio home electrical monitor this becomes a very powerful product. You can keep tabs on how much electricity you are using in real time. This has allowed me to identify several energy wasters in our home including a refrigerator that was malfunctioning, using about three times as electricity as it should. It can record very small changes, letting you know if a single LED light has turned on. It could even be used to detect if someone is home who shouldn't be or if someone isn't home who should be.

title: Awesome app and product!
text:
I've been very impressed!   Was super easy to install the Neurio hardware in my panel.   The App and website both work great!

I researched all the other offerings out there and this one kept staying at the top of my list.

Glad I bought it.   I wanted to figure out why my electric bills were consistently $300+.   With Neurio over the course of 3 months..... We have reduced our bill to less than $110/month.   I foresee being under $100/month within the next month.

I had used a killawatt meter to check various appliances before but you don't get to see the whole picture.   I just used it to make sure I knew my fridge and freezer didn't have a stuck defrost timer leaving the heating coil on and that they were drawing less than the name plate rated amps.

Using Neurio, quickly saw various improvements could be made.   Checking what various items used.   Lights, lamps, TV's, ceiling fans, furnace, AC, fridge, freezer, dishwasher, dishwasher with heated wash and dry cycles, outdoor lights, dehumidifier and various vampire loads like satellite receivers, computers in sleep, monitors in standby...etc.

Invested in some inexpensive LED bulbs from Menards.   Adjusted refrigerator and freezer set points to the temps they should be.... We're too low before.   Got the family to make sure they stop leaving lights on all over the house and start turning ceiling fans off when not needed.

Amazingly, my ceiling fans are horrible energy wasting devices.    Researching further.... They make decent ones, they just cost more, so keep in mind.... It all adds up, so pay attention to the wattage each device uses and note that better more efficient models are available.

This all possible due to being in the know because of Neurio.
